content:
FigureStructure Class

Definition

Represents a drawing, chart, or diagram in a document.

In this Article

public class FigureStructure : System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.SemanticBasicElement, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.NamedElement>, System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild
Inheritance
Object
BlockElement
SemanticBasicElement
FigureStructure

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Examples

The following example shows use of the FigureStructure element as part of an XPS document. 

<StoryFragment StoryName="DocumentBody" FragmentType="Content">
  <SectionStructure>

    <TableStructure>
      <TableRowGroupStructure>
        <TableRowStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R6C1P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R6C2P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
        </TableRowStructure>
      </TableRowGroupStructure>

      <TableRowGroupStructure>
        <TableRowStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R7C1P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R7C2P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
        </TableRowStructure>

        <TableRowStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R8C1P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R8C2P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
        </TableRowStructure>

        <TableRowStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R9C1P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R9C2P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
        </TableRowStructure>

        <TableRowStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R10C1P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R10C2P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R10C2P2" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
        </TableRowStructure>

        <TableRowStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R11C1P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R11C2P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
        </TableRowStructure>

        <TableRowStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R12C1P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
          <TableCellStructure>
            <ParagraphStructure>
              <NamedElement NameReference="R12C2P1" />
            </ParagraphStructure>
          </TableCellStructure>
        </TableRowStructure>

      </TableRowGroupStructure>
    </TableStructure>

    <ParagraphStructure>
      <NamedElement NameReference="Pg2Heading1" />
    </ParagraphStructure>

    <ParagraphStructure>
      <NamedElement NameReference="Pg2P1" />
    </ParagraphStructure>

    <ParagraphStructure>
      <NamedElement NameReference="Pg2P2" />
    </ParagraphStructure>

    <FigureStructure>
      <NamedElement NameReference="Pg2Fig1" />
    </FigureStructure>

  </SectionStructure>
</StoryFragment>

Remarks

A FigureStructure can be a child of any of these document structure elements:

  • StoryFragment
  • SectionStructure
  • TableCellStructure
  • ListItemStructure

Constructors

FigureStructure()

Initializes a new instance of the FigureStructure class.

public FigureStructure ();

Methods

Add(NamedElement)

Add a named element to the figure.

public void Add (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.NamedElement element);
Parameters
element
NamedElement

The element to add.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The element is null.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IEnumerable<NamedElement>.GetEnumerator()

This method is not implemented.

System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.NamedElement> IEnumerable<NamedElement>.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator<NamedElement>

Always raises NotSupportedException.

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

This method has not been implemented.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

Always raises NotSupportedException.

IAddChild.AddChild(Object)

This member supports the Microsoft .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

void IAddChild.AddChild (object value);
Parameters
value
Object

The child Object to add.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

value is not one of the types that can be a child of this class. See Remarks.

Remarks

Adds a child element to the FigureStructure.

Only NamedElement can be a child of FigureStructure. If there are multiple children, they should together constitute a single drawing, chart, or diagram.

IAddChild.AddText(String)

Adds the text content of a node to the object.

void IAddChild.AddText (string text);
Parameters
text
String

The text to add to the object.
